Definition.WordDefinition:
Brevity \Brev"i*ty\, n.; pl. {Brevities}. [L. brevitas, fr. brevis short: cf. F. bri[`e]vit['e]. See {Brief}.] 1. Shortness of duration; briefness of time; as, the brevity of human life. [1913 Webster]
2. Contraction into few words; conciseness. [1913 Webster]
Brevity is the soul of wit. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
This argument is stated by St. John with his usual elegant brevity and simplicity. --Bp. Porteus. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Shortness; conciseness; succinctness; terseness. [1913 Webster]
brevity n 1: the use of brief expressions 2: the attribute of being brief or fleeting [syn: {briefness}, {transience}]
